channel.title: How to fix inventory models?
channel.description:
[IMG]http://i49.tinypic.com/raw1g9.jpg[/img]
How do i rotate the models? or fix the inventory models so they look like the item?
Torva pernix virtus ancient ceremonial all look like that everything but the helm!

item.title: How to fix inventory models?
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

lol i know that i just want the model + ints lol

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix inventory models?
item.dc:creator: @usman555 usman555
item.description:
@usman555 wrote:

You have to make two separate models while making an item.

Model 1 - Equip (This is what you probably did correctly)
Model 2 - Dropped/Inventory (This is where you went wrong)

Usually, you would name Model 1 something like 1007 and Model 2 would be something like 1008. The numbers are close to each other so you know that the first one is for equip and the second one is for drop/inven.

As a solution, make or download a model for drop/inven and use it.

Read full topic

item.title: How to fix inventory models?
item.dc:creator: @RSPS222 RSPS222
item.description:
@RSPS222 wrote:

[code]How do i rotate the models? or fix the inventory models so they look like the item?

Torva pernix virtus ancient ceremonial all look like that everything but the helm!
1.To fix the inventory model you can download new one but it Harder or you can change the item rotate How?
2.Go to Class.8 java, now look for your item Found it?
now i tell you what every int do:
[class8.anInt174 = ITEM ID;//inventory/drop model
class8.anInt181 = MODEL ZOOM;//Model Zoom
class8.anInt190 = ROTATION 1;//model rotate up+down increase to move doen away from you
class8.anInt198 = ROTATION 2;//model rotate side ways increase to move right in circle
class8.anInt169 = MODEL OFFSET;//model offset increase to move to the right
class8.anInt194 = MODEL OFFSET;//model offset increase to move up
class8.anInt165 = MALE MODEL ID;//male wield ModelId
class8.anInt200 = FEMALE MODEL ID;//female wield ModelId
class8.anInt188 = -1;//female sleeve
class8.anInt164 = -1;//male sleeve
class8.aString170 = “ITEM NAME”;//name
class8.aByteArray178 = “ITEM DESCRIPTION”.getBytes();
}]
[/code]
Hope it helped - :eek:
oh and can you send me the max cape or complienst cape MODELS+INTS?

Read full topic
